project.description: This job is managed by JJB! Changes must be done in git This job will redeploy scenario-9: DVR Neutron - 7 nodes - HA with SBD (2 nodes) - ceph (3 nodes) - 2 kvm compute nodes - Neutron: linuxbridge and OVS It will wipe all QA2 machines!

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: hw_number
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Mandatory, name of the QA cloud server as integer

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: admin_os
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Mandatory, admin node operating system version

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: networkingplugin
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: networking plugin to be used by Neutron. Available options are: openvswitch:gre, vlan, vxlan / linuxbridge:vlan

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: networkingmode
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Networking mode to be used by Neutron. Available options are gre, vlan, vxlan

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: tempest
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Optional, specify what tempest test(s) to run, e.g. smoke, smoke|full or smoke|defcore

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: cct
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Optional, specify cct tests to run

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: ssl_type
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Mandatory, set the SSL configuration for the cloud, available options: no-ssl, ssl-insecure, ssl

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: cloud_version
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Mandatory, version of the cloud to be installed as integer

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: TESTHEAD
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: if non-empty, test latest version from Devel:Cloud:Staging

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: hacloud
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: By default we do not want HA configured and installed

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: clusterconfig
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: HA configuration for clusters. Make sense only if hacloud=1

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: nodenumber
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Number of nodes to use; is scenario specific

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: commands
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: All the steps that needs to be completed to have cloud installed
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.defaultValue: addupdaterepo prepareinstallcrowbar runupdate bootstrapcrowbar installcrowbar allocate waitcloud setup_aliases

hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.name: UPDATEBEFOREINSTALL
hudson.model.BooleanParameterDefinition.description: add update repos before crowbar install

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#!/bin/bash admin=crowbar$hw_number cloud=qa$hw_number
if [ ! -z "$UPDATEREPOS" ] ; then export UPDATEREPOS=${UPDATEREPOS//$'\n'/+} fi
export artifacts_dir=$WORKSPACE/.artifacts rm -rf $artifacts_dir mkdir -p $artifacts_dir touch $artifacts_dir/.ignore
# destroy the old admin VM if any and spawn a clean new admin VM afterwards # /usr/local/sbin/freshadminvm freshadminvm $admin $admin_os sleep 100 # time for the admin VM to boot
# clone, fetch and update the automation repo # /usr/local/sbin/update_automation update_automation
# rest of code runs on admin node: env | grep -e networking -e libvirt -e cloud > mkcloud.config
# copy scripts/ directory onto the admin node in /root/scripts scp -r ~/github.com/$repo_owner/automation/scripts mkcloud.config root@$admin:
# copy scenario file onto the admin node in /root/scenario.yml scp ~/github.com/$repo_owner/automation/scripts/scenarios/cloud$cloud_version/qa/$ssl_type/$scenario_file \ root@$admin:scenario.yml
ret=0
ssh root@$admin " export cloud=$cloud ; export UPDATEREPOS=$UPDATEREPOS ; export UPDATEBEFOREINSTALL=$UPDATEBEFOREINSTALL ; export TESTHEAD=$TESTHEAD ; export cloudsource=$cloudsource ; export nodenumber=$nodenumber ; export hacloud=$hacloud ; export clusterconfig=$clusterconfig ; export want_node_aliases=controller=2,compute=2,ceph=3 ; export want_node_roles=controller=2,compute=2,storage=3 ; export want_ceph=1 ; export want_dvr=1 ; export networkingplugin=openvswitch ; export networkingmode=vlan ; export cephvolumenumber=1 ; export networkingplugin=$networkingplugin ; export networkingmode=$networkingmode ; export scenario=\"/root/scenario.yml\" ; export commands=\"$commands\" "'
sed -i -e "s,##networkingplugin##,$networkingplugin," scenario.yml sed -i -e "s,##networkingmode##,$networkingmode," scenario.yml
[ $UPDATEBEFOREINSTALL == "true" ] && export updatesteps="addupdaterepo runupdate"
timeout --signal=ALRM 240m bash -x -c "source scripts/qa_crowbarsetup.sh ; onadmin_runlist $commands" ' || ret=$?
echo "mkphyscloud ret=$ret (before scenario)"
if [ "$ret" = "0" ]; then # ----- Prepare the SBD setup: cat > /tmp/sbd_prepare_$admin <<EOSCRIPT # preparation of iSCSI export ZYPP_LOCK_TIMEOUT=120 zypper --gpg-auto-import-keys -p http://download.opensuse.org/repositories/devel:/languages:/python/SLE_12_SP2/ --non-interactive install python-sh
chmod +x scripts/iscsictl.py
./scripts/iscsictl.py --service target --host \$(hostname) --no-key ./scripts/iscsictl.py --service initiator --target_host \$(hostname) --host controller1 --no-key ./scripts/iscsictl.py --service initiator --target_host \$(hostname) --host controller2 --no-key
# preparation of SBD SBD_DEV1=\$(ssh controller1 echo '/dev/disk/by-id/scsi-\$(lsscsi -i | grep LIO | tr -s " " |cut -d " " -f7)') SBD_DEV2=\$(ssh controller2 echo '/dev/disk/by-id/scsi-\$(lsscsi -i | grep LIO | tr -s " " |cut -d " " -f7)') ssh controller1 "zypper --non-interactive install sbd; sbd -d \$SBD_DEV1 create" ssh controller2 "zypper --non-interactive install sbd; sbd -d \$SBD_DEV2 create" # watchdog configuration ssh controller1 modprobe softdog; echo softdog > /etc/modules-load.d/watchdog.conf ssh controller2 modprobe softdog; echo softdog > /etc/modules-load.d/watchdog.conf # take scenario yaml file and replace /dev/sda with the right thing: sed -i "s|@@sbd_device_1@@|\${SBD_DEV1}|g" scenario.yml sed -i "s|@@sbd_device_2@@|\${SBD_DEV2}|g" scenario.yml # ----- End of SBD EOSCRIPT
chmod +x /tmp/sbd_prepare_$admin scp /tmp/sbd_prepare_$admin root@$admin:sbd_prepare
# Check if zypper is used by other application ssh root@$admin ' source scripts/qa_crowbarsetup.sh; for node in $(crowbar machines aliases | grep "controller" | grep -oE "^.*[[:space:]]"); do wait_for 20 10 "ssh $node \"zypper refresh\"" "zypper to be available on $node" done '
ssh root@$admin './sbd_prepare ' || ret=$?
fi
if [ "$ret" = "0" ]; then ssh root@$admin " export cloud=$cloud ; export TESTHEAD=$TESTHEAD ; export cloudsource=$cloudsource ; export nodenumber=$nodenumber ; export hacloud=$hacloud ; export clusterconfig=$clusterconfig ; export want_ceph=1 ; export want_dvr=1 ; export networkingplugin=openvswitch ; export networkingmode=vlan ; export cephvolumenumber=1; export scenario=scenario.yml "'
timeout --signal=ALRM 240m bash -x -c "source scripts/qa_crowbarsetup.sh ; onadmin_runlist batch;" ' || ret=$?
if [ $ret != 0 ] ; then ssh root@$admin ' set -x for node in $(crowbar machines list | grep ^d) ; do ( echo "Collecting supportconfig from $node" timeout 400 ssh $node supportconfig | wc timeout 300 scp $node:/var/log/\*tbz /var/log/ )& done timeout 500 supportconfig | wc & wait '
scp root@$admin:/var/log/*tbz $artifacts_dir/ fi >&2 echo "mkphyscloud ret=$ret" fi exit $ret

hudson.plugins.parameterizedtrigger.Pred.properties: hw_number=$hw_number tempest=$tempest cct_tests=$cct scenario_name=9 scenario_job_name=$JOB_NAME scenario_build_number=$BUILD_NUMBER
